short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Causes all links to external sites from hackernews to open in a new tab.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This will make any https? links displayed on http://news.ycombinator.com that do not go to a ycombinator.com site to be target=_blank so that they open in a new tab.  Reddit has an option to turn this on automatically, so I'm used to not having to open in a new tab.  I hate losing my HN tab and having to reopen.

https://github.com/dave-mccloskey/hackernews-newtab
